text.description: Silvio Berlusconi was last night facing demands for a reality TV show on one of his channels to be scrapped after it provoked viewer outrage and a threat of an advertising boycott, reports John Hooper.
text.title: Berlusconi TV shocker causes fury

main.p: Silvio Berlusconi was last night facing demands for a reality television show on one of his channels to be scrapped after it provoked viewer outrage and a threat of an advertising boycott.

A young woman's breast enlargement operation was featured on Scalpel - Nobody's Perfect, a programme in which viewers volunteer for cosmetic surgery. It is shown on Italia 1, owned by Mr Berlusconi, who himself underwent a facelift recently.
Religious and parents' groups lodged protests and threats of legal action. The food firms Nestl√© and Ferrero were among advertisers saying they were withdrawing support from the show.
The producers said there had been calls for the show to be longer, adding: "It would be a mistake to pretend cosmetic surgery did not exist."
